title: david678345
author: david678345
content: Hi, do you know any exchange to trade bitcoin without fees? I saw a video some time ago and I think it was mentioned that there were some exchanges without fees...but they were not very well known...for me it would be the difference between being profitable or not being profitable scalping...I would not mind that then I would be charged a significant amount when withdrawing money from the exchange...because once you get to be profitable you can earn enough money...so in my opinion it would be beneficial both for me and for the exchange....Anyway, I suppose that the liquidity of the exchange would also have to be taken into account...when choosing the exchange...any exchanges to trade bitcoin without fees?

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: Binance were doing a promotion some time ago (it might still be active and probably is) for trading without fees.Aside from that I don't think there's options without exchanges the recoup fees based on spreads.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on September 05, 2022, 09:30:37 PMIf david678345 is a scalper, likely he trades derivatives (future trading) to be able to open long and short position. Exchanges do not use derivative market trading fee to joke, they are charging fee for it.For derivative market, use Binance perpetual BUSD pair, you will be able to trade with low fee. He's talking about trading bitcoin, probably pointing to buying and selling on spot market. not shorting or longing BitcoinOp, you might wanna look at the different spot trading tiers of different exchanges. Some exchanges offer 0 Market maker fees for holding a specified number of the exchange token like it is the case with Bybit - https://blog.bybit.com/post/major-benefits-of-the-bitdao-bit-holders-incentive-program-blt2d769d73fd57e5a6/

comments.body: I dont think we should continue to talk about the transaction fee of bitcoin as been high at all. comments.body: Maybe it's Bybit in order to celebrate 10 million users. comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Indeed, since you're planning to do some scalping, liquidity should be the primary consideration. So I would probably prioritize liquidity over zero trading fee if the exchange has very low liquidity. Just go for exchanges with low fees. Please verify this, but I think KuCoin only charges up 0.10% for their taker/maker fees. It lowers down depending on your tier. But KuCoin is a decent exchange with decent volume and their low fees are not exclusive to certain pairs. So if you set a conservative target of 0.30% to 0.50% for your trades, it wouldn't hurt to pay 0.10% or lower.
